content: Muslims pray 5 times daily facing Mecca, the holiest city in Islam.
The Quran has 114 chapters called Surahs, revealed over 23 years.
Prophet Muhammad was born in 570 CE in the city of Mecca.
There are 99 Beautiful Names of Allah describing His attributes.
Ramadan lasts 30 days, during which Muslims fast from dawn to sunset.
The 5 Pillars are: Shahada, Salah, Zakat, Sawm, and Hajj.
Muslims give 2.5% of their wealth in Zakat to help the poor.
The Night Journey took Prophet Muhammad from Mecca to Jerusalem.
Islam has 2 main celebrations: Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha.
The Islamic calendar has 12 months, starting with Muharram.
Friday is the holy day when Muslims gather for Jummah prayer.
The Angel Jibreel revealed the Quran to Prophet Muhammad.
